III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/24/25, two youth went AWOL from the facility and were living
on the streets. There are concerns that staff are hitting one of the
youth as the youth has bruises on the left arm and shins. The
youth were both back at the facility on 9/25/25.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 1, 2025. Youth A presented as very distracted and was
jumping from topic to topic, changing what he was reporting
throughout the interview. Youth A was asked about having bruises
on his arms and he pointed his thumb towards the door, when
asked to clarify who he was pointing to he said “everyone here”,
when asked if he was speaking about youth or staff, he said he
was kidding and that his bruises all came from a former foster
parent that he lived with three years ago. Youth A was asked if he
had bruises on his legs and he rolled up his pant legs and said no
he just had bug bites. Youth A was asked if any of the staff ever
hurt him while placed at Wolverine Center and he reported Staff 1
had punched him with a closed fist last Tuesday in the hallway
outside his room at 7pm. Youth A then stated that he was “just
playing” with Staff 1 and had hit him first. Youth A reported Youth B
had been hit by staff in the chest, however, did not report which
staff. Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility and asked to end
the interview.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 1, 2025. Youth B presented with a speech impairment,
making it very difficult to understand him when he spoke in full
sentences however he was understandable when giving short,
single word answers to questions. Youth B was asked if any staff
ever hit him at Wolverine Center and he said “no”. Youth B was
asked if any staff ever hurt him in any way at Wolverine Center
and he said “no”. Youth B was asked if he felt safe at Wolverine
Center and he said “yes”.
2

Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 1, 2025. Youth C presented with cognitive impairments
and therefore was asked direct questions. Youth C was asked if
any staff have ever hurt him at Wolverine Center and he shook his
head no. Youth C was asked if he felt safe at Wolverine Center
and he shook his head yes.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at Carstens Elementary
School on October 10, 2025. Youth D said staff do not hit Youth
A. Youth D said staff do not horseplay with Youth A or any other
youth. Youth D said “staff” slap him across his face and throw him
to the ground but was unable to provide who is doing this, when
they are doing it, or if any other youth or staff are aware this
occurs. Youth D became frustrated and said he cannot remember
anything and then got up and walked out of the room.
Youth E was not interviewed due to being AWOL.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 16, 2025. Youth F said he has never seen or heard of
Staff 1 hitting Youth A or any other youth, stating “he’s a good staff
to work with”. Youth F said he has not heard or seen any staff slap
Youth D or any other youth at the facility.
Foster Care Worker provided information via email on
September 30, 2025. Foster Care Worker is assigned to work
with Youth E. Foster Care Worker reported Youth E went AWOL
from Wolverine Center on September 28, 2025. Foster Care
Worker said Youth E called her and stated he did not want to go
back to Wolverine Center because “staff hits the kids”. Foster
Care Worker said she asked Youth E if he was hit and he said
“no”. Foster Care Worker said she asked Youth E which youth
were being abused, and he stated he did not know them. Foster
Care Worker said she asked Youth E which staff were hitting the
youth, and he could not name any staff members.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on October 9, 2025.
Staff 1 said he has never punched Youth A either seriously or as
horseplay. Staff 1 said Youth A will horseplay often and will fake
punch people and then run in the other direction however he
denied engaging in the horseplay with Youth A. Staff 1 said he has
never seen any staff being physically aggressive towards Youth A
or any other youth. Staff 1 said he has never seen any staff
engage in horseplay behaviors with Youth A or any other youth.
Staff 1 said he has had a good relationship with Youth A however
3

noted he had to be watched carefully because once he “gets in his
feelings” he tends to runaway.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on October 16, 2025. Staff 2 and Staff 3 both reported they do
not have any knowledge of Staff 1 hitting Youth A or any other
youth. Staff 2 and Staff 3 both reported they have not seen or
heard of any staff slapping Youth D or any other youth. Staff 2 and
Staff 3 both reported that if they had concerns with other staff they
would immediately address it with them and the supervisor on
shift.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was discipline on 10/11/2024
for failing to properly intervene in helping de-escalate youth
as required by policy, 3/11/2025 for attendance, 7/21/2025
for attendance, 9/1/2025 for attendance, and 9/23/2025 for
not wearing the required uniform. Staff 1 was trained in
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention through Crisis Prevention
Institute on 9/30/2025.
• Incident Report for Youth A dated 9/27/2025, indicating he
had went AWOL and returned. The incident report indicates
upon his return “no new marks or bruises or injuries” noted.
• Wolverine Human Services Policy Handbook was reviewed.
The policy outlines prohibited interventions which includes
“use of physical discipline inflicted in any manner”.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of September 23, 2025, shelter floor was reviewed
on October 21, 2025. The video footage did not show Staff 1 or
Youth A in the hallway on the shelter floor during the timeframe
provided by Youth A.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, and video review there is no evidence that Staff 1 or
any other staff are hitting Youth A or any other youth at Wolverine
Center.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
